title: California Elections Roundup 08/01/2018
text:
California Elections Roundup 08/01/2018
Recent News
By Ben Christopher
Barack Obama endorsed 81 Democrats across the country today—ten in California. Some were obvious choices. Others—both of omission and commission—not so much.
By Dan Morain
Kentucky Gov. Matt Bevin exhorted conservative donors at a Koch Network gathering earlier this week to donate to Republican gubernatorial candidate John Cox, and called Democrat Gavin Newsom a “dirtbag,” a “joke” and an “embarrassment to public service.”
By Dan Morain
A statewide poll shows that voters prioritize water storage projects and addressing the drought above other environmental concerns.
By Dan Morain
A new statewide poll shows that voters are increasingly concerned about environmental policy, which could play out in the governor’s race between Newsom and Cox.
By Dan Morain
Homeowners 55 and older could pay the lower property tax bills of their old homes when moving to more expensive homes with this November ballot measure.
